Articles.Content:
Hi, 

Using a weak Aspire 5745 laptop (replacement for a fried desktop), I've been putt-puttin my way into space here since Aug-2013, all the way to 0.90. Often getting 1 Kerbal second of flight for every 10-20 seconds sitting in front of the screen for all but the relatively simple stuff. 

Now I'm fortunate to have a new desktop with a fine cpu, lots of ram, SSD, a GTX 980 connected to a 27" - 1ms - 144Hz monitor. I expected great things! I saved long enough for them lol. 

Here's the thing. Since I loaded Kerbal Space Program - 1.0.2.842 (WindowsPlayer) I cannot get KPS out of 3D! After I turned off 3D in the graphics card (active), passive appeared to have kicked in (red & green). Searched everywhere I could think of in the card's Control Panel, nothing more than I already switched. I hunted in the game as well and nothing "3D" was mentioned.

So that it. If anyone has any ideas, please let me know. Thanks!

p.s. If this is in the wrong place to post this, let me know and it'll be moved.

- - - Updated - - -

I was able to fix this issue. Thanks for any time put into it.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-19T23:31:53Z" title="06/19/2015 11:31  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 19, 2015</time> by Glasher**
Maybe you might add how you fixed it, if someone has a similar problem?
